xxl.core.io
Class Convertables

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.io.Convertables

public abstract class Convertables
extends Object

This class contains various methods connected to the serialization of convertable objects. The write methods write (iterators of) convertable objects to files and buffer the writing process.

The documentation of the methods contained in this class includes a brief description of the implementation. Such descriptions should be regarded as implementation notes, rather than parts of the specification. Implementors should feel free to substitute other algorithms, as long as the specification itself is adhered to.

See Also:
BufferedOutputStream, DataOutputStream, File, FileOutputStream, IOException, Iterator, SingleObjectCursor

Constructor Detail

Convertables

public Convertables()
Method Detail

write

public static int write(File outputFile,
                        Iterator iterator,
                        int bufferSize)
Writes an iterator of convertable objects to the given file and returns the number of written objects. A buffer of the specified size is used for buffering the writing process.
This implementation opens a new buffered data output stream on the given file and writes all objects contained by the specified iterator to it.

Parameters:
outputFile - the file to which to write the objects.
iterator - the iterator containing the convertable objects to be written.
bufferSize - the size of the buffer used for buffering the writing process.
Returns:
the number of written objects (number of called to the iterator's next method).
Throws:
WrappingRuntimeException - when any exception is throws during the object writing process.

write

public static int write(File outputFile,
                        Iterator iterator)
Writes an iterator of convertable objects to the given file and returns the number of written objects. A buffer of 1024*1024 bytes is used for buffering the writing process.
This implementation is equivalent to the call of write(outputFile, iterator, 1024*1024).

Parameters:
outputFile - the file to which to write the objects.
iterator - the iterator containing the convertable objects to be written.
Returns:
the number of written objects (number of called to the iterator's next method).

write

public static int write(File outputFile,
                        Convertable convertable)
Writes a convertable object to the given file and returns the number of written objects. A buffer of 1024*1024 bytes is used for buffering the writing process.
This implementation is equivalent to the call of write(outputFile, new SingleObjectCursor(convertable), 1024*1024).

Parameters:
outputFile - the file to which to write the object.
convertable - the convertable objects to be written.
Returns:
the number of written objects (usually 1).
See Also:
SingleObjectCursor

write

public static int write(String outputFile,
                        Iterator iterator,
                        int bufferSize)
Writes an iterator of convertable objects to the file with the given name and returns the number of written objects. A buffer of the specified size is used for buffering the writing process.
This implementation is equivalent to the call of write(new File(outputFile), iterator, bufferSize).

Parameters:
outputFile - the name of the file to which to write the objects.
iterator - the iterator containing the convertable objects to be written.
bufferSize - the size of the buffer used for buffering the writing process.
Returns:
the number of written objects (number of called to the iterator's next method).

write

                        Iterator iterator)
Writes an iterator of convertable objects to the file with the given name and returns the number of written objects. A buffer of 1024*1024 bytes is used for buffering the writing process.
This implementation is equivalent to the call of write(outputFile, iterator, 1024*1024).

Parameters:

iterator - the iterator containing the convertable objects to be written.
Returns:
the number of written objects (number of called to the iterator's next method).

write

public static int write(String outputFile,
                        Convertable convertable)
Writes a convertable object to the file with the given name and returns the number of written objects. A buffer of 1024*1024 bytes is used for buffering the writing process.
This implementation is equivalent to the call of write(outputFile, new SingleObjectCursor(convertable), 1024*1024).

Parameters:
outputFile - the name of the file to which to write the object.
convertable - the convertable objects to be written.
Returns:
the number of written objects (usually 1).
